GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/topics.description: serves an array of all topics

GET /api/articles.description: serves an array of all articles

GET /api/articles/:article_id.description: takes an article id and serves the corresponding article

article.title: Running a Node App
article.body: This is part two of a series on how to get up and running with Systemd and Node.js. This part dives deeper into how to successfully run your app with systemd long-term, and how to set it up in a production environment.

POST /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: takes an article id and a  request body containing two properties (username and body) and posts a new comment, serving the newly posted comment as its response

DELETE /api/comments/:comment_id.description: takes a comment id and deletes its corresponding comment, serving a 204 response.

GET /api/users/:username.description: takes a username and serves the corresponding user
